system.biography:
TitleFFF 506-4 Feudal Knight HH
Birthday12 Nolus 695
AppearanceAge 24, height 6â 2â, massive frame, weight 220 lb, average appearance, medium complexion, black hair, blue eyes
Medical/PsycheMild alcoholism, WIL x 5 to resist drinking excessively
Size8
ArmorLeather knee boots and gauntlets, cloth shirt and leggings. Quilt cowl, Khuzan made plate greaves, kneecops, thigh plates, ailettes, coudes, and great helm (AQ +1, Â¾ normal weight). Khuzan made scale hauberk (AQ +2, Â¾ normal weight). Dagger, broadsword, knight shield. Add lance and handaxe while travelling
Other EquipmentBelt pouch
ValuablesÂ£3 in gold, 778d in silver in several money pouches
Notes

Biography

Sir Chadrin lives for three things: fighting, drinking, and wenching. The third son of the bailiff of Milnyrd manor (Chybisa), Charles was knighted on his twenty-first birthday in 717. He left home with a priceless suit of armour, an aging warhorse, a dented shield, a poor quality sword and instructions not to come back.

Chadrinâs great grandfather travelled widely before coming to Chybisa. During his travels he acquired a suit of Khuzan armour; how, he never revealed. He settled in Milnyrd and never aspired to be anything greater than the bailiff of a small manor. When it became apparent that neither of his sons would be able to wear his armour, he put an inscription inside the helmet; âWhomsoever of my descendants can wear this armour properly, mount their horse unaided, and still fight, may have it as their birthrightâ. Many tried to fulfil those terms, but only Chadrin succeeded. The matching sword and shield that once accompanied the armour were lost during the Treasure War.

To say that Chadrin is unpopular oversimplifies a long series of problems, the most important of which is a longstanding, bitter rivalry with Rithalyr Legith, the son of his familyâs liege lord. Neither of them truly remembers the incident that started their rivalry, but have nothing but contempt for the other. Sir Chadrin believes that Rithalyr blocked his bid to join the Chybisan Royal Guard. Rejected by the Royal Guard, Sir Chadrin went to the one person in the country that might take him in, Baron Kjal Forsetha. Kjal knew of his fighting abilities (having seen him fight in the squireâs tournament the year before), and despite, or perhaps because of, the political ramifications, offered him a position in his company of huscarls.

Chadrin has found working for the Baron and the Ivinian nature of his court much to his liking. Despite this, he remains devoted to Larani, often debating the nature of the gods over beer with his Sarajin worshipping compatriots. In 719, Sir Chadrin used his considerable tournament winnings to register his personal, and somewhat unorthodox, heraldry of Three Mugs over Crossed Swords.

Adventure Hooks

The Khuzan Shield: One of the PCs has a Khuzan made shield. Sir Chadrin recognizes it as the one meant to go with his armour. He will offer to purchase it first, then a challenge if denied.

The Drunken Knight: Sir Chadrin is making his way home after one of his ârareâ nights of drinking to excess. He encounters the PCs while deep in his cups. He is still a dangerous combatant.

Credits
